article.headline: Western Kentucky 82, Louisiana-Lafayette 72
article.story: BOWLING GREEN, Ky. (AP) -- Tyrone Brazelton scored a career-high 22 points to lead Western Kentucky to an 82-72 victory over Louisiana-Lafayette Saturday night in Sun Belt Conference play. Brazelton helped pick up the slack for Courtney Lee, the leading scorer for the Hilltoppers (14-5, 6-1 SBC) who missed his second consecutive game with an ankle injury. It was the second straight game for the junior college transfer to set a new career high. He scored 21 points in Western Kentuckys win Thursday night at Florida International. Louisiana-Lafayette (4-14, 2-6 SBC) led throughout most of the first half and grabbed 21 offensive rebounds in the game, but the Ragin Cajuns hurt themselves by making just 8 of 22 free throws and 4 of 20 3-pointers. Orlando Mendez-Valdez scored 12 points for Western Kentucky, while freshman forward Jeremy Evans scored 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds. Daniel Emerson scored 11 points for the Hilltoppers, who lead the Sun Belt Conference East Division. Elijah Millsap paced Louisiana-Lafayette with 19 points and grabbed a game-high 13 rebounds. David Dees added 16 points and Ross Mouton added 14 for the Ragin Cajuns.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
